title: Saturday Boredom Busters
text:
October 16,   
The 10th annual Expo for Her is a day of shopping fun, entertainment and pampering for women of all ages. There are more than 200 vendors selling jewelry, purses, shoes, home decor and children's items from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Sioux Falls Convention Center. There will also be seminars throughout the day. The first 200 attendees receive a bag full of gifts. Tickets are $6, $5 with a canned good donation for the Sioux Falls Food Pantry. 
Dress as your favorite Star Wars character during an Intergalactic Fundraiser at the Sertoma Butterfly House & Marine Cove. This family-friendly Halloween event runs from 6-8 p.m. All proceeds benefit the Sertoma Butterfly House located in Sertoma Park at 53rd and Oxbow. 
"Reading Takes You Places" is the Sioux Empire United Way's 15th Annual Reading Festival from 9 a.m. to noon at the Ramkota Exhibit Hall in Sioux Falls. The festival includes kids' activities and crafts, live storybook readings plus literacy information for parents. 
The Sioux Valley Model Engineers Society is hosting an Open House at the W.H. Lyon Fairgrounds. Check out South Dakota's largest model train layout from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission is free. 
Haunted Farm in Worthing is 25 acres of screaming fear featuring The Loft of Lunatics, Spooks in the Dark and the Shadows Hayride. The hours are from 6 p.m. to midnight. From Sioux Falls, go south on I-29 and take exit 68 and go east 3.5 miles. Haunted Farm is open Thursdays through Saturdays through Halloween. 
The Fraternal Order of Police is hosting a haunted house in Sioux Falls called Twisted Nightmare from 7 p.m. to midnight. Admission is $6, $5 with a canned food donation. The haunted house is located at 2601 S. Louise. 
The Sioux Falls Jaycees Haunted House goes from 7 p.m. to midnight at the Fine Arts Building at the W.H. Lyon Fairgrounds. Admission is $8, $6 with a canned food donation. A $16 fast pass lets you jump to the front of the line. 
The Sioux Falls Area Humane Society is hosting a Howl-o-ween Spooktacular from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. The event includes a craft and bake sale, plus pet trick-or-treating and a costume contest. All proceeds will benefit the Humane Society, located at 3720 East Benson Road.
